title: Romain du Roi specimen
content:
Does anyone know if a printed specimen (or high res online images) of Romain du Roi print specimen can be found somewhere in the US?

Thanks!
author: brampitoyo

comments.content: [This old thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010347/http:/typophile.com/node/6411) suggests that these are hard specimens to track down. Try getting in touch with Dan Reynolds and find out if that book was any good, if so you can just order a copy from [Amazon France](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011010347/http:/www.amazon.fr/Romain-typographie-service-lEtat-1702-2002/dp/2856820174).

As I mentioned in the other thread, I enjoyed the book, at least as much as was possible without being able to read it ;-)

But I'm a sucker for type books. I shell out money for almost anything if I think that I could possibly learn from it, now or in the future.

But aren't we all, Mr. Dan :) ?

James' response on the other topic is great. A bit overwhelming, but in a very good way.
